extracted-table.table-caption: Demographics and clinical characteristics of subjects

caption.p: Demographics and clinical characteristics of subjects

fn.p: Note: Numerical variables are presented as mean ± standard deviation.

Abbreviations: cerebellar signs (−/+), + is defined as at least one of the following symptoms: gait ataxia, limb ataxia, cerebellar dysarthria, or cerebellar oculomotor dysfunction; otherwise, patients were labelled as −; HC, healthy control; H‐Y stage, Hoehn and Yahr staging; LEDD, levodopa equivalent daily dose; MDS‐UPDRS‐III, Movement Disorder Society‐Sponsored Revision of the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale‐part III (severity of motor symptoms); MMSE, Mini‐Mental State Examination; MSA‐P, multiple system atrophy with predominant parkinsonism; MoCA, montreal cognitive assessment; NA, not available; PD, Parkinson's disease.

extracted-table.table-caption: Regions showing decreased nodal centralities in the MSA‐P/IPD groups compared with HC participants

caption.p: Regions showing decreased nodal centralities in the MSA‐P/IPD groups compared with HC participants

tr.th: p values for post hoc tests

fn.p: Note: Date are mean ± standard deviation.

Abbreviations: HC, healthy control; HES, Heschl gyrus; IPD, idiopathic Parkinson's disease; MSA‐P, multiple system atrophy with predominant parkinsonism; MTL, middle temporal gyrus; SFGdor, dorsolateral frontal gyrus; SFGmed, medial superior frontal gyrus; STG, superior temporal gyrus; TPOsup, temporal pole: superior temporal gyrus.
p value reach statistically significant differences for comparisons among MSA‐P, IPD, and HC participants obtained by using ANCOVA with FDR‐correlation.
p value reach statistically significant differences in PD and HC comparison after FDR‐correlation.
p value reach statistically significant differences in MSA‐P and HC comparison after FDR‐correlation.

extracted-table.table-caption: Top 15 connectome features with maximum discriminative ability selected by RF for differentiating MSA‐P from IPD patients

fn.p: Abbreviations: AAL, automated anatomical labeling; BGN, basal ganglia network; CEN, cerebellum network; DMN, default‐mode network; FC, functional connectivity; IPD, idiopathic Parkinson's disease; MSA‐P, multiple system atrophy with predominant parkinsonism; Ne, nodal efficiency; RF, random forest.
